sentences: Daniel Zamir (Hebrew: דניאל זמיר; born 1980 in Petah Tikva) is an Israeli religious Jewish saxophonist and singer.
He completed his studies at The New School in 2002.
In 2007, Zamir recorded I Believe for Zorn's label with the killing rhythm section of Zorn, including Joey Baron on drums, Uri Caine on piano and Greg Cohen on double bass.
In 2015, Zamir released Redemption Songs on Tzadik, featuring another killing band including Mark Guiliana on drums, Shai Maestro on piano and more great Israeli musicians.
In 2006, he recorded his fifth album, Amen, under the Israeli label "Hatav Hashmini", with Omer Avital on bass, Daniel Friedman on drums and Omri Mor on piano.
In 2009, Zamir released a second album on the "Hatav Hashmini" label titled Echad (One).
He performed with guitarist Nitzan Bar at the 14th Philippine International Jazz Festival in 2019.
